topicDetails.contextText:
Description: A creamy, savory pasta made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper. Ingredients: Spaghetti, eggs, Parmesan cheese, pancetta, black pepper, salt .
        Since the name is derived from carbonaro, some people believe the dish was first made as a hearty meal for Italian charcoal workers. In parts of the United States, this etymology 
        gave rise to the term coal miner's spaghetti.John F. Mariani writes that some people believe it was created as a tribute to the Carbonari (lit.'charcoal burners') secret society 
        prominent in the early, repressed stages of Italian unification (Risorgimento) in the early 19th century.It seems more probable that it is an "urban dish" from Rome. 
        Spice Level: Mild . Country of Origin: Italy.

Description: Traditional pizza topped with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, and basil, representing the colors of the Italian flag.A popular contemporary legend holds that 
        the archetypal pizza Margherita was invented in June 1889, when the Royal Palace of Capodimonte commissioned the Neapolitan pizzaiolo Raffaele Esposito to create a pizza in honor of the visiting 
        Queen Margherita. Of the three different pizzas he created, the queen strongly preferred a pizza swathed in the colors of the Italian tomato, green (basil), and white (mozzarella). Supposedly, 
        this type of pizza was then named after the queen. Ingredients: Pizza dough, fresh tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, basil, olive oil, salt. Spice Level: Mild . Country of Origin: Italy.

Description: A creamy and cheesy pasta dish, loved worldwide.Cheese and pasta casseroles were recorded in the 14th century in the Italian cookbook Liber de Coquina, which featured a 
        dish of Parmesan cheese and pasta. A cheese and pasta casserole known as makerouns, was recorded in the 14th-century medieval English cookbook the Forme of Cury.Ingredients: Macaroni pasta, cheddar cheese, milk, butter, flour, salt, black pepper.
        Spice Level: Mild .Country of Origin: United States (popularized)

Description: Lasagna originated in Italy during the Middle Ages. The oldest transcribed text about lasagna appears in 1282 in the Memoriali Bolognesi ('Bolognese Memorials'), in which lasagna was mentioned in a poem transcribed by a Bolognese notary.
        it has Layers of pasta, meat sauce, and béchamel, baked to perfection.Ingredients: Lasagna noodles, ground beef, tomato sauce, béchamel sauce, mozzarella, Parmesan cheese, onion, garlic, olive oil, salt, pepper.
        Spice Level: Mild to ModerateCountry of Origin: Italy

Description: A flavorful Thai noodle dish, stir-fried with tofu, peanuts, and vegetables, usually with a balance of sweet, salty, and sour flavors .Pad Thai was originally called "Kuai Tiao Pad Thai" but this was later shortened to simply Pad Thai.
        Ingredients: Rice noodles, shrimp or tofu, peanuts, bean sprouts, eggs, tamarind paste, fish sauce, lime, chili flakes.Spice Level: Moderate . Country of Origin: Thailand.

Description: Simple yet delicious pasta made with garlic, olive oil, and red pepper flakes.This dish is typical of the Italian city of Naples, in the Campania region , This dish was once also known as vermicelli alla Borbonica.
        Ingredients: Spaghetti, garlic, olive oil, red pepper flakes, parsley, Parmesan cheese, salt. Spice Level: Moderate .Country of Origin: Italy.

Description: A comforting Japanese noodle soup with broth, noodles, meat, and vegetables.Ramen is a Japanese noodle dish. It consists of Chinese-style wheat noodles served in a broth.
        Ingredients: Ramen noodles, chicken or pork broth, soy sauce, mirin, green onions, seaweed, boiled egg, garlic, chili paste. Spice Level: Mild to Moderate (varies) .Country of Origin: Japan

Description: Mexican street tacos with marinated pork, pineapple, onion, and cilantro, served on corn tortillas. Al pastor (from Spanish, "herdsman style"), tacos al pastor, or tacos de trompo is a
        preparation of spit-grilled slices of pork originating in the Central Mexican region of Puebla and Mexico City.Ingredients: Corn tortillas, marinated pork, pineapple, onion, cilantro, lime, chili powder.
        Spice Level: Moderate .Country of Origin: Mexico.

Description: A creamy and rich chicken curry with a mild heat and tomato-based sauce.Butter chicken, traditionally known as murgh makhani is an Indian dish originating in Delhi.
        Ingredients: Chicken, tomatoes, cream, butter, ginger, garlic, garam masala, cumin, chili powder. Spice Level: Mild to Moderate .Country of Origin: India.

Description: A traditional Vietnamese noodle soup with fragrant broth, beef, rice noodles, and fresh herbs.Phở originated in the early 20th century in Northern Vietnam, and after the Vietnam War, refugees popularized it throughout the world.
        Ingredients: Beef or chicken broth, rice noodles, thinly sliced beef, basil, cilantro, lime, fish sauce, chili paste. Spice Level: Mild to Moderate (varies) .Country of Origin: Vietnam
